climbs.name: Bain de soleil
climbs.fa: P1 LouisT Shreiber, Francis Lessard (April 2021). P2 Jeff Beaulieu, Daniel Morin (March 2021)

content.description:
A nice route with lot of morning sun. An all size crack pot-pourri. Show what you got! P1 - Start in a steep handcrack a little to the right of the line to a stance. Clip the bolt and traverse left. Then follow the obvious crack system to the top. An anchor is on an obvious nohand ledge at 15-18m. P2 - Follow the obvious crack to the top. P1 - Bolted rap anchors
P2 - Bolted rap anchors P1 and 2 can be linked for 40m (triple your gear!!) An 80m rope could possibly get you to the ground from P2 anchor, tie knots at the end of rope!!!

climbs.name: Le Meunier
climbs.fa: Jeff Beaulieu et Dan Ti-Bum Morin March 2021 (P1), April 2021 (P2)

content.description:
P.1 - Follow the obvious crack system to the top. Start at the obvious and magnificent hand/fist crack. P.2 - Finish with the large flake (2x #4 required, a #5 could be useful). P1 - Bolted rap anchors
P2 - Bolted rap anchors

P1 - Follow the obvious, but hard, finger crack at start. After the nohand stance, go up, then traverse left with an awkward fridge move. Spicy, hot stuff!  P2 - Go toward the cave/roof and follow obvious crack after. Whoooooaaaa! P1 - Bolted rap anchors
P2 - Bolted rap anchors

A small gem with long an continuous cracks, a rarity in the region.

The area is still in development. Contact route setters before going there.  facebook.com/groups/4773953…

The approach is short (about 15 min).

Be mindful with the people living in the 2 cottages on the lake. Keep voices down (since the cliff is highup, the sound can be heard very far).
